translation.about1: I am a Masterâ€™s degree student with a strong passion for personal projects. skillData.name: HTML
skillData.description: Markup language used to structure web pages.

skillData.name: TypeScript
skillData.description: Superset of JavaScript that adds static typing support, improving code maintainability.

skillData.description: JavaScript library for building reactive, component-based user interfaces.

skillData.description: JavaScript runtime environment for server-side development, based on the V8 engine.

skillData.description: Minimalist Node.js framework that simplifies API and web server creation.

skillData.name: Rust
skillData.description: Modern, safe programming language ideal for high-performance system development.

skillData.name: MongoDB
skillData.description: NoSQL document-oriented database used for handling large volumes of flexible data.

skillData.name: MySQL
skillData.description: Relational database management system (RDBMS) widely used for web applications and enterprise software.

skillData.description: Advanced open-source relational database with support for complex SQL operations.

skillData.name: SQLite
skillData.description: Lightweight, self-contained SQL database engine commonly used for embedded systems and small applications.

skillData.description: Versatile and easy-to-learn programming language used in web development, AI, and automation.

skillData.name: GraphQL

skillData.description: Code analysis tool that helps improve software quality and security.

projects.name: Softwork
projects.description: Project developed for the Software Engineering course, during the Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering. This software, built using the JavaFX framework, allows you to manage the shifts of an entire company. Each employee can clock in and out on different terminals placed around the company.

projects.name: MiSvaGo
projects.description: Project developed for a travel package booking app. This project was developed using Kotlin and XML, with Retrofit for HTTP calls.

projects.name: What Do You Meme
projects.description: Project developed for the WebApp1 course. This project was developed with both a backend and a frontend. The backend was created using Node, Express, and JavaScript, while the frontend used React, Bootstrap, and JavaScript.

education.name: Master's degree in Computer Science at Politecnico di Torino
education.description: In this course, I have taken various classes that helped me grow professionally, working on several projects with international teams. I studied distributed systems in-depth, as well as DevOps and agile technologies.

education.name: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science at University of Palermo
education.description: During this degree, I faced multiple steps, starting with engineering subjects like electronics and analysis, and moving to more IT-focused subjects like Java, MySQL, Android, and Kotlin. I also had the chance to work in several teams during various projects.
